prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0675, 0.0]. This coordinate system will be used to define the first part of the assembly, a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Next, draw a 2D sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system. The sketch should contain a single face (face\\_1). Face\\_1 should be a rectangle with four lines: - line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.3, 0.0] - line\\_2: Start Point [0.3, 0.0], End Point [0.3, 0.75] - line\\_3: Start Point [0.3, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75] - line\\_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Now that the 2D sketch has been created, scale it using the sketch\\_scale parameter of 0.75. Apply a 3D rotation to the scaled 2D sketch using the euler\\_angles and translation\\_vector defined in the coordinate system. Next, perform an extrusion using face\\_1. Set the extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal to 0.0675 and the extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal to 0.0. This will create a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, with the height being the extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal, width being the distance between the first and last point of line\\_1, and the length being the distance between the first and last point of line\\_2. Finally, add a description to the CAD model. Include 'shape' (rectangular prism), 'length' (0.75), 'width' (0.0675), and 'height' (0.75) in the description. This will help in keeping track of the dimensions of the CAD model for future reference. Note: The above explanation is as per the JSON provided, However in practice it is recommended to use the parametric features available in CAD tools and let them perform the calculation and generate the model. Please check if you need any other information on this.</description>
